setting.atmosphere: torchlit halls, cold stone, whispered conspiracies
setting.weather: Bitter winter wind howling through arrow slits

victim.name: Lord Edmund Blackwood
victim.causeOfDeath: Pushed from the east tower battlement
victim.description: Cruel lord who taxed his people mercilessly during the plague years. Recently discovered to be selling information about English defenses to the French.

characters.name: Sir Roland Ashford
characters.role: Castle Knight and Captain of Guards
characters.personality: Honor-bound but haunted, struggles with conflicting loyalties
characters.background: Saved Lord Edmund's life at Crécy but discovered his treason. Torn between oath and duty to England.
characters.motive: Lord Edmund's treason endangered every English soldier, including Roland's own men
characters.alibi: Claims he was inspecting the night watch on the west wall

relationships.lady-margaret-blackwood: Secretly admires her strength, pities her marriage
relationships.brother-thomas: Distrusts his ambitions for the castle
relationships.elara-moonweaver: Respects her healing skills, knows she dabbles in poison
relationships.aldric-cooper: Sees him as weak but useful for information
relationships.gwendolyn-shaw: Protective of her, knows Edmund abused her

secretKnowledge: Lord Edmund was meeting someone in the tower that night
Lord Edmund threatened to reveal Roland killed prisoners at Crécy
characters.speechPattern: Formal military bearing, occasionally slips into battlefield coarseness
characters.greeting: You there. State your business quickly — these are dark times and I have little patience for idle chatter. The lord's death has left us... vulnerable.

characters.name: Lady Margaret Blackwood
characters.personality: Intelligent, bitter, secretly relieved by her husband's death
characters.background: Forced into marriage at 14, endured years of cruelty. Recently learned Edmund killed her beloved brother.
characters.motive: Freedom from an abusive marriage and revenge for her brother's murder
characters.alibi: In the chapel praying with witnesses until 10:45 PM

relationships.sir-roland-ashford: Respects his honor, helped him discover the treason
relationships.brother-thomas: Despises his greed and false piety
relationships.elara-moonweaver: Her only true confidant, knows her herbs
relationships.aldric-cooper: Father of her child, still loves him
relationships.gwendolyn-shaw: Protective of her, sees her younger self

secretKnowledge: Edmund was sterile, her son is the stable master's
Edmund planned to have her killed
She gave Roland the tower patrol schedule
characters.speechPattern: Refined speech with occasional cutting remarks, quotes scripture ironically
characters.greeting: Ah, another vulture come to pick at my husband's corpse? Or perhaps you seek truth in this den of liars? Either way, tread carefully.

characters.name: Brother Thomas
characters.role: Castle Chaplain and Edmund's younger brother
characters.personality: Ambitious, manipulative, hides greed behind piety
characters.background: Second son who joined the church for power, not faith. Believes the castle should be his by right.
characters.motive: Inherit the castle as Edmund had no legitimate heir
characters.alibi: Leading evening prayers in the chapel until 10:30 PM

relationships.sir-roland-ashford: Fears his military power, tries to manipulate him
relationships.lady-margaret-blackwood: Wants her gone, knows about her son
relationships.elara-moonweaver: Suspects she's a witch, fears her knowledge
relationships.gwendolyn-shaw: Lusts after her, makes her uncomfortable

secretKnowledge: Edmund changed his will last week
The stable master is Lady Margaret's lover
characters.speechPattern: Quotes scripture frequently, unctuous tone, passive-aggressive
characters.greeting: Bless you, my child. In these times of trial, we must seek comfort in prayer. Though I wonder... do you come seeking absolution or accusation?

characters.name: Elara Moonweaver
characters.personality: Wise, secretive, fiercely protective of those she cares about
characters.background: Learned herb lore from her grandmother, rumored to practice old ways. Saved many during the plague.
characters.motive: Edmund threatened to burn her as a witch for refusing to poison his wife
characters.alibi: Tending to sick servants in the lower bailey

relationships.sir-roland-ashford: Treated his war wounds, knows his guilt
relationships.lady-margaret-blackwood: Her closest ally, protects her secrets
relationships.brother-thomas: Sees through his false faith, mutual antagonism

secretKnowledge: Lady Margaret asked for moon tea
Edmund was slowly being poisoned already
characters.speechPattern: Soft-spoken with hints of old wisdom, sometimes speaks in riddles
characters.greeting: The stones whisper of blood tonight, and you seek answers among shadows. Be warned — some truths cut deeper than any blade.

characters.name: Aldric Cooper
characters.personality: Gentle, tormented by guilt, devoted to Lady Margaret
characters.background: Rose from peasant stock through skill with horses. Has loved Lady Margaret since youth.
characters.motive: Lord Edmund discovered the affair and threatened to have him flayed alive
characters.alibi: In the stables tending a sick horse, no witnesses

relationships.sir-roland-ashford: Fears him but respects his treatment of horses
relationships.lady-margaret-blackwood: Desperately loves her, would die for her
relationships.elara-moonweaver: Grateful for her discretion about his son
relationships.gwendolyn-shaw: Kind to her, sees her as a little sister

secretKnowledge: Saw Roland heading to the tower
characters.speechPattern: Common speech, stammers when nervous, avoids eye contact with nobility
characters.greeting: M-my lord/lady? I'm just a simple stable master... I don't know nothing about the high affairs of nobles. Best I tend to the horses and leave the rest be.

characters.name: Gwendolyn Shaw
characters.personality: Observant, loyal, harbors deep trauma and rage
characters.background: Orphaned by plague at 12, Lord Edmund took her in but abused her for years. Lady Margaret protected her.
characters.motive: Years of abuse and a recent assault by Lord Edmund that left her with child
characters.alibi: Preparing Lady Margaret's chambers for night, seen by other servants until 10:20 PM

relationships.sir-roland-ashford: Sees him as protector, told him about Edmund's abuse
relationships.lady-margaret-blackwood: Devoted to her, would kill for her
relationships.brother-thomas: Terrified of him, avoids being alone with him
relationships.elara-moonweaver: Learning herbs from her, trusts her completely
relationships.aldric-cooper: Sees as gentle soul, knows his secret

secretKnowledge: Saw Brother Thomas near the tower
characters.speechPattern: Soft and proper in public, drops to common dialect when emotional
characters.greeting: Begging your pardon, but I've duties to attend to. Unless... unless you're here about his lordship? I shouldn't speak ill of the dead, but... *wrings hands*

locations.name: East Tower Battlement
locations.description: Wind-swept stone platform atop the highest tower. Dark bloodstains mark where Lord Edmund fell. The parapet is lower here, damaged in last winter's siege.

locations.name: Great Hall
locations.description: Massive chamber with vaulted ceiling and faded tapestries depicting the Blackwood arms. The lord's chair sits empty at the high table, wine cup still half-full.

locations.name: Castle Chapel
locations.description: Stone sanctuary with colored glass windows. Incense cannot mask the scent of fear. Prayer books lie scattered, and candle wax pools suggest recent vigil.

locations.name: Lord's Solar
locations.description: Edmund's private study. Maps of English and French positions cover one wall. The hearth is cold, papers hastily burned leave readable fragments.

locations.name: Herbarium
locations.description: Elara's domain, filled with drying herbs and mysterious vials. Mortar and pestle show recent use. Books of herb lore mixed with older, stranger texts.

locations.name: Castle Stables
locations.description: Warm despite winter, filled with hay and horse scent. Tack hangs neatly, but one stall shows signs of struggle. A hidden loose stone conceals secrets.

evidence.name: Torn Surcoat Fragment
evidence.description: A piece of blue and silver fabric caught on battlement stone
evidence.detailedDescription: High-quality wool with the Ashford arms partially visible. Fresh tear suggests recent struggle. Thread count indicates knight's garment.

evidence.name: Pouch of French Gold
evidence.description: Hidden leather pouch with 30 French écus
evidence.detailedDescription: Coins dated 1346, after Crécy. Pouch bears French lily seal. Found with half-burned letter mentioning 'payment for castle plans'.

evidence.name: Annotated Prayer Book
evidence.description: Brother Thomas's prayer book with suspicious notes
evidence.detailedDescription: Margins contain inheritance law citations and calculations of castle income. One passage about 'fraternal duty' heavily underlined.

evidence.name: Hemlock Residue
evidence.description: Traces of processed hemlock in mortar
evidence.detailedDescription: Fresh grinding of hemlock root, enough for several lethal doses. Mixed with honey to mask bitter taste. Preparation method suggests expertise.

evidence.name: Hidden Love Letter
evidence.description: Passionate letter in Lady Margaret's hand
evidence.detailedDescription: Addressed to 'My beloved A--', mentions 'our son' and 'when I am free'. Hidden in stable hay, ink still fresh.

evidence.name: Chapel Witness Statement
evidence.description: Servant saw Lady Margaret in prayer until 10:45 PM
evidence.detailedDescription: Kitchen maid Martha swears Lady Margaret remained in chapel from 10:00 to 10:45, praying fervently. Brother Thomas left at 10:30.

evidence.name: Blood Under Victim's Nails
evidence.detailedDescription: Lord Edmund has blood and blue fabric under his nails. Pattern suggests he grabbed at his attacker's clothing during struggle.

evidence.name: Altered Guard Schedule
evidence.description: Tonight's patrol routes with suspicious changes
evidence.detailedDescription: Original schedule crossed out, rewritten to leave east tower unguarded 10:30-11:00. Roland's seal, but handwriting seems forced.

evidence.name: Gwendolyn's Hidden Bruises
evidence.description: Fresh bruises on maid's arms match Edmund's hands
evidence.detailedDescription: Distinctive finger-pattern bruising on upper arms, consistent with forceful grabbing. Healing suggests assault 2-3 days ago.

evidence.name: Muddy Riding Boots
evidence.description: Aldric's boots caked with fresh mud
evidence.detailedDescription: Mud from lower bailey, not stables. Pattern suggests running. Found hidden behind hay bales, still damp despite dry night.

evidence.name: Partially Burned Letter
evidence.description: Fragment mentions meeting at tower tonight
evidence.detailedDescription: "...meet at east tower when bell tolls eleven. Come alone or our arrangement..." Rest burned. Edmund's seal visible.

evidence.name: Broken Confessional Seal
evidence.detailedDescription: Records of castle confessions he should have destroyed. Notes about Roland's war guilt, Lady Margaret's affair, Edmund's treason.

evidence.name: Tainted Wine Cup
evidence.description: Lord Edmund's cup shows traces of slow poison
evidence.detailedDescription: Wolfsbane traces in residue, enough to weaken but not kill. Would explain Edmund's recent fatigue. Someone was already slowly poisoning him.

evidence.name: Stable Boy Statement
evidence.description: Claims Aldric never left the stables
evidence.detailedDescription: Young Tom insists Aldric was with sick mare all evening. But Tom is known to hero-worship Aldric and lie for him.

evidence.name: Roland's War Journal
evidence.description: Private thoughts about honor and duty
evidence.detailedDescription: Recent entry: 'Cannot serve both crown and conscience. E's treachery dishonors all who died at Crécy. Tonight I must choose: oath to lord or duty to England.'

solution.method: Pushed Lord Edmund from the east tower battlement during a confrontation about his treason
solution.motive: Lord Edmund's sale of castle defenses to the French would lead to countless English deaths. Roland's honor as a knight demanded action.
solution.explanation: Sir Roland discovered Lord Edmund was selling military intelligence to the French. After wrestling with his conscience, he confronted Edmund on the tower at 10:45 PM. Edmund threatened to reveal Roland's war crimes at Crécy. In the ensuing struggle, Roland pushed Edmund off the battlement. The torn surcoat, blood under Edmund's nails, and Roland's own journal entries confirm his guilt. He altered the guard schedule to ensure they'd be alone.

timeline.event: Lady Margaret enters chapel for evening prayers
Gwendolyn finishes preparing chambers, leaves servants' wing
Brother Thomas concludes prayers and leaves chapel
Guard change - east tower left unpatrolled per altered schedule
Lord Edmund leaves solar, heads to east tower for meeting
Sir Roland arrives at east tower
Confrontation between Roland and Edmund begins
Edmund pushed from battlement during struggle
Roland returns to west wall, resumes 'inspection'
